resources.string: Enable backdrop blur in dark mode (Android 12+)
This app has no advertisements and no tracking
Press + to create your first formula.
Are you sure you want to delete %1$s?
Points above this accuracy threshold are rejected when recording stems.
Map: show only reliable GPS points
Hide stems whose horizontal precision is above the configured threshold.
Only points below this value are considered reliable on the map.
Write crashes to local logs (for debugging)
Open the most recent crash log, if any
Save the most recent log as a text file
Archive all local crash logs into a ZIP file
Create periodic ZIP backups in app storage
Choose a destination and save a ZIP export
Replace current price tables with default values?
Load indicative timber prices for a French region. This will replace your current price table.
Interactive map (MapLibre) will be enabled in a future version.
No geolocated stems in this plot. Enable GPS when recording to see trees on the map.
Diameter %.1f cm is unusually large — please verify
Height %.1f m is unusually large — please verify
Height/diameter ratio is extreme — likely data entry error
Height/diameter ratio is very high — slender tree or error?
Form coefficient %.2f is outside typical range (0.15–0.85)
Computed volume is negative — calculation error
Volume %.2f m³ per tree exceeds physical limits
Volume %.2f m³ per tree is very large — please verify
Computed volume is incoherent with diameter
%1$d potential duplicate entries detected (same species + diameter within 1 min)
Plot surface is zero — cannot compute per-hectare values
Plot surface is very small — per-hectare values may be inflated
N/ha = %1$d is extreme — check plot surface
N/ha = %1$d is very high — verify plot surface
G/ha = %.1f m² is extreme — check data
G/ha = %.1f m² is very high for French forests
G/ha = %.2f m² is very low — sparse stand or partial data?
V/ha = %.0f m³ is extreme — check data
V/ha = %.0f m³ is very high — verify heights and surface
V/G ratio = %.1f is unusually low — check volume calculation
V/G ratio = %.1f is unusually high — check heights
Revenue per tree is abnormally high
Revenue/ha is negative — check price tables
⚠ GPS signal unavailable — location capture may fail
⚠ Poor GPS accuracy (±%.0f m) — threshold is ±%.0f m. Move to an open area for better signal.
%1$d stems have GPS but precision exceeds %2$d m threshold.\nDisable the precision filter or move to open sky.
Free disk space by removing all offline tiles
Delete all offline tiles? You will need to re-download them from the map screen.
No shapefile imported. Import a .zip containing a shapefile (.shp + .dbf + .prj) to display forest parcels on the map.
Import failed. Check that the .zip contains valid .shp, .dbf and .prj files.
Delete parcel "%1$s"? All plots and stems will be removed.
Delete plot "%1$s"? All stems will be removed.
Choose a color for this species
Tip: long-press a color to reset to automatic color.
Delete %1$s from this plot? %2$d stems will be removed.
Delete this plot? %1$d stems will be removed.
GPS precision too low (±%1$.1f m). Max accepted: %2$.1f m.
No stem to remove for %1$d cm
You must enter heights to compute volume.
The active tariff (%1$s) is a 2-entry method and requires heights to compute volume. Fill them in now or switch to a 1-entry tariff.
Apply the same height to all empty classes
%1$s m³ (%2$d%% of the volume) has no price mapping. Import prices and/or product rules.
Plot: summary limited to this plot
Parcel: all plots in the parcel
Project / forest: all parcels in this project
Global: all parcels and plots in the app
Error: no stems found for this scope. Add stems or change view to display the summary tiles.
No conifer species detected in this scope.
Error: sample area is missing or zero. Volume, G and Price tiles remain hidden until this value is provided.
Dm (arithmetic mean): %1$s cm · Hm (mean height): %2$s m
Assess remaining stems quality to refine pricing
Optional: enter stand values before harvest to compute removal rates
Error: the summary could not be computed with the current data (volume/price tariffs or incompatible heights). Tiles remain disabled.
Volume is partial until heights are provided for: %1$s.
These values are required to compute the pre-cut table.
Enter in m² (e.g. 2000) or in hectares (e.g. 0.2 ha)
You can then refine heights by species and diameter class in the mini-menu.
No stems for this species in this scope.

Enter a mean height by diameter class (m). You can enter multiple heights separated by commas (e.g. 25,20,27): the mean will be used. Leave blank only if all stems in that class have a measured height.
Show a background image on the main screens
Prevent the screen from turning off while using the app
V = a + b × C² — 1-entry tariff (circumference only). Schaeffer, 1949.
V = a + b × C² × H — 2-entry tariff (circumference + height). Schaeffer, 1949.
V = a × D^b × H^c — Algan tariff for regular stands. Algan, 1958.
IFN 1-entry tariffs (n° 1–36). V = f(DBH). National Forest Inventory.
IFN 2-entry tables (DBH, H). National Forest Inventory.
V = F × G × H — explicit variant with form factor.
V = G × H × f — Classic method with form/taper factor.
This method does not require heights (1-entry tariff).
Configure volume allocation by product per species
Stems with all forestry attributes, EPSG:4326
Your professional field assistant for timber marking and forest inventory.
Designed for foresters, surveyors and woodland managers
Works offline — ideal for field conditions
All your forestry data in one place
Structure your data into forests, plots and subplots. Add your species and configure the appropriate volume tariffs.
Create forests, plots and subplots freely
95+ tree species with detailed forestry data
Enter diameter, height, quality and GPS for each tree. Geolocation lets you visualize your stems on the map.
Quick diameter entry by class with +/− buttons
Wood quality grading (A/B/C/D) with product classification
Optional height input when tariff doesn\'t require it
Each stem can be geolocated automatically. Multi-reading averaging improves accuracy for precise mapping.
Visualize your stems on the map with 12 cartographic layers including IGN, cadastre and forest maps.
12 map layers: IGN, satellite, forests, cadastre…
Download tiles for offline use in the field
Tap on stems to see their details on the map
Complete dendrometric synthesis with dashboard charts: volume, basal area and estimated revenue by species.
Volume, basal area, density per hectare
Visual dashboard with charts and statistics
Timber marking simulation with harvest rates
Export your data in multiple formats for reporting, GIS analysis or archiving.
PDF synthesis report with full dendrometric tables
GeoJSON and Shapefile for QGIS / ArcGIS
Create your first plot to start recording stems. Each plot can have multiple subplots with different tariff methods.
Add subplots to organize your inventory. Each subplot can have its own species and diameter classes.
Tap a diameter class to add a stem. Long press to remove one. GPS is captured automatically if enabled in settings.
Switch layers with the layer button. Download tiles for offline field use with the cloud button.
Select species to include in the synthesis. Volume and revenue are computed automatically based on your tariff and prices.
